name: apibuilder api
description: Host API documentation for applications providing REST APIs, facilitating the design of good resource first APIs.

values.name: api_json
values.description: The original is in the api.json format

values.name: avro_idl
values.description: The original is in Avro Idl format

values.name: service_json
values.description: This is the canonical service spec for apibuilder itself. See https://www.apibuilder.io/apicollective/apibuilder-spec/latest#model-service

values.name: swagger
values.description: The original in the Swagger JSON or YAML format

enums.name: publication
enums.description: A publication represents something that a user can subscribe to. An example would be subscribing to an email alert whenever a new version of an application is created.

values.name: membership_requests.create
values.description: For organizations for which I am an administrator, email me whenever a user applies to join the org.

values.name: memberships.create
values.description: For organizations for which I am a member, email me whenever a user joins the org.

values.name: applications.create
values.description: For organizations for which I am a member, email me whenever an application is created.

values.name: versions.create
values.description: For applications that I watch, email me whenever a version is created.

enums.name: visibility
enums.description: Controls who is able to view this version

values.name: user
values.description: Only the creator can view this application

values.name: organization
values.description: Any member of the organization can view this application

values.name: public
values.description: Anybody, including non logged in users, can view this application

unions.name: diff
unions.description: Represents a single diff in an application

unions.name: item_detail
unions.description: Identifies the specific type of item that was indexed by search

types.description: Represents that the item indexed was an application

models.name: application
models.description: An application has a name and multiple versions of its API.

fields.name: guid
fields.description: Internal unique identifier for this application.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The unique name for this application.

fields.name: key
fields.description: Used as a unique key in the URL path. Key is automatically derived from the application name.

fields.name: visibility
fields.description: Controls who is able to view this application

fields.name: last_updated_at
fields.description: The updated_at of this application or created_at of it's latest version

fields.name: key
fields.description: Defaults to a key generated from the application name

fields.name: guid
fields.description: Internal unique identifier for this application.

fields.name: key
fields.description: Used as a unique key in the URL path. Key is automatically derived from the application name.

models.name: application_metadata_version
models.description: Describes the versions associated with a given application

models.name: application_summary
models.description: Summary of an application sufficient for display and links

models.name: attribute
models.description: Attributes are globally unique key which allow users to specify additional content to pass in to the code generators.

fields.name: guid
fields.description: Internal unique identifier for this attribute.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the attribute. Globally unique and an 'identifier' (lower case, url safe, etc.)

fields.name: description
fields.description: Optional description - a good description here will indicate which code generators it applies to and what effect it will have on those code generators.

fields.name: guid
fields.description: Internal unique identifier for this attribute.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the attribute. Globally unique and an 'identifier' (lower case, url safe, etc.)

models.name: attribute_value
models.description: Attribute values can be set at different levels. Initially we support setting organization wide attributes, but in the future plan to support setting attribute values with each version of the application.

fields.name: guid
fields.description: Internal unique identifier for this attribute value.

models.name: authentication
models.description: Represents the result of a successful authorization

models.name: change
models.description: Represents a single change from one version of a service to another

fields.name: changed_at
fields.description: Records the timestamp of when the actual change occurred (vs. when we created the changed record)

fields.name: changed_by
fields.description: Records who made the actual change

models.name: change_version
models.description: Represents a simpler model of a version specifically for the use case of displaying changes

models.name: cleartext_token
models.description: Separate resource used only for the few actions that require the full token.

fields.name: token
fields.description: The actual token. Guaranteed to be globally unique.

models.name: code
models.description: Generated source code.

fields.name: source
fields.description: The actual source code.

fields.name: files
fields.description: A collection of source files

models.name: diff_breaking
models.description: Represents a single breaking diff of an application version. A breaking diff indicates that it is possible for an existing client to now experience an error or invalid data due to the diff.

models.name: diff_non_breaking
models.description: Represents a single NON breaking diff of an application version.

fields.name: description
fields.example: name diffd from foo to bar

models.name: domain
models.description: Represents a single domain name (e.g. www.apibuilder.io). When a new user registers and confirms their email, we automatically associate that user with a member of the organization associated with their domain. For example, if you confirm your account with an email address of example@somedomain.com, we will automatically create a membership request on your behalf to join the organization with domain somedomain.com.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The domain name

models.name: email_verification_confirmation_form
models.description: Data used to confirm an email address. The token is an internal unique identifier used to lookup the specific email address and user account for which we sent an email verification email.

fields.name: code
fields.description: Machine readable code for this specific error message

fields.name: message
fields.description: Description of the error

models.name: generator_service
models.description: Defines a service that provides one or more code generators

models.name: generator_with_service
models.description: Wraps a service and a generator providing easier access for applications.

models.name: item
models.description: When searching for content, the results of the search will be a list of items. Each item will have enough information to render for the user, including a type and item_guid to enable creating the appropriate link.

fields.name: guid
fields.description: Unique identifer for this item. By using a UUID, you can combine with the type to figure out the URI for the resource

models.name: membership
models.description: A membership represents a user in a specific role to an organization. Memberships cannot be created directly. Instead you first create a membership request, then that request is either accepted or declined.

fields.name: guid
fields.description: Internal unique identifier for this membership.

fields.name: role
fields.description: The role this user plays for this organization. Typically member or admin.

models.name: membership_request
models.description: A membership request represents a user requesting to join an organization with a specific role (e.g. as a member or an admin). Membership requests can be reviewed by any current admin of the organization who can either accept or decline the request.

fields.name: guid
fields.description: Internal unique identifier for this membership request.

fields.name: role
fields.description: The requested role for membership to this organization. Typically member or admin.

fields.name: org_key
fields.description: The key of the organization to which we are moving this item

models.name: organization
models.description: An organization is used to group a set of applications together.

fields.name: guid
fields.description: Internal unique identifier for this organization.

fields.name: key
fields.description: Used as a unique key in the URL path. Key is automatically derived from the organization name.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of this organization.

fields.name: namespace
fields.description: Global namespace for this organization.

fields.name: key
fields.description: Defaults to a url friendy version of the name

fields.name: namespace
fields.description: Global namespace for this organization.

fields.name: visibility
fields.description: Public organizations will be listed in apibuilder directory. Organizations with visibility organization will only be visible to members of that org.

models.name: original
models.description: Represents the original input used to create an application version

fields.name: type
fields.description: If not specified, we set the type by inspecting the data

models.name: password_reset
models.description: Allows a user to change their password with authentication from a token.

fields.name: token
fields.description: Unique one time use token to change a password

models.name: password_reset_request
models.description: Create a password reset request - e.g. an email containing a one time URL to change a password

fields.name: email
fields.description: The email address for which we generate the password reset.

models.name: session
models.description: Represents a user sessions (e.g. user logged into site)

fields.name: id
fields.description: Cryptographically secure session id

models.name: subscription
models.description: Represents a user that is currently subscribed to a publication

fields.name: guid
fields.description: Internal unique identifier for this subscription record

models.name: token
models.description: A token gives a user access to the API.

fields.name: guid
fields.description: Internal unique identifier for this token.

fields.name: user
fields.description: The user to which this token belongs.

fields.name: masked_token
fields.description: The masked from of the token.

fields.name: description
fields.description: optional description to help the user manage the token.

fields.name: user_guid
fields.description: The user for which we are creating the token.

models.name: user
models.description: A user is a top level person interacting with the api doc server.

fields.name: guid
fields.description: Internal unique identifier for this user.

fields.name: nickname
fields.description: Public unique identifier for this user.

fields.name: nickname
fields.description: Defaults to a unique identifier based on email address

models.name: user_summary
models.description: Summary of a user sufficient for display

models.name: validation
models.description: Used only to validate json files - used as a resource where http status code defines success

fields.name: valid
fields.description: If true, the json schema is valid. If false, there is at least one validation error.

fields.name: errors
fields.description: Contains any validation errors that result from parsing the json document. If empty, the document is valid.

models.name: version
models.description: Represents a unique version of the application.

fields.name: guid
fields.description: Internal unique identifier for this version.

fields.name: version
fields.description: The tag for this version. Can be anything, but if semver style version number is used, we automatically correctly sort by version number to find latest. Otherwise latest version is considered to be the most recently created.

fields.name: original
fields.description: The original uploaded file describing this version, if available

fields.name: service
fields.description: spec/spec.json description of this API

fields.name: visibility
fields.description: If provided, updates the visibility for all versions of this application

models.name: watch
models.description: Users can watch individual applications which enables features like receiving an email notification when there is a new version of an application.

fields.name: guid
fields.description: Internal unique identifier for this watch

operations.description: Returns the versions assocoated with the specified application. The latest version is the first result returned.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of records to return

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Used to paginate. First page of results is 0.

operations.description: Returns the latest version number as a string
Search all applications. Results are always paginated.

parameters.name: orgKey
parameters.description: The organization key for which to search applications

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of an application. Case in-sensitive. Exact match

parameters.name: guid
parameters.description: The guid of an application. Exact match

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of an application. Case in-sensitive. Exact match

parameters.name: has_version
parameters.description: If true, we return applications that have at least one version. If false, we return applications that have no versions in the system

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of records to return

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Used to paginate. First page of results is 0.

operations.description: Create an application.
Updates an application.
Deletes a specific application and its associated versions.
Moves application to a new organization.
Search all attributes. Results are always paginated.

parameters.name: guid
parameters.description: Find the watch with this guid.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Find attributes with this name. Case in-sensitive. Exact match

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of records to return

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Used to paginate. First page of results is 0.

operations.description: Returns the attribute with this name.
Create a new attribute.
Deletes the attribute with this name. Only the user who created an attribute can delete it.
Retrieve multiple applications in one api call.

parameters.name: org_key
parameters.description: Filter changes to those made for the organization with this key.

parameters.name: application_key
parameters.description: Filter changes to those made for the application with this key.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Filter changes to those made from this version.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: Filter changes to those made to this version.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of diff to return.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of records to return

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Used to paginate. First page of results is 0.

operations.description: Create an invocation form. This is useful primarily for debugging when you want to see exactly what content is being forwarded to the generator
Generate code for a specific version of an application.

parameters.name: orgKey
parameters.description: The organization key for which to generate code

parameters.name: applicationKey
parameters.description: The application key for which to generate code

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: The version of this application. Can be 'latest'

parameters.name: generatorKey
parameters.description: The key of the generator to invoke

responses.description: If the target, version, and/or generator are invalid.

operations.description: Generate code for a specific version of an application.

parameters.name: orgKey
parameters.description: The organization key for which to generate code

parameters.name: applicationKey
parameters.description: The application key for which to generate code

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: The version of this application. Can be 'latest'

parameters.name: generatorKey
parameters.description: The key of the generator to invoke

responses.description: If the target, version, and/or generator are invalid.

operations.description: Add a domain to this organization
Remove this domain from this organization
Validate an email address using a token.
List all generator services

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of records to return

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Used to paginate. First page of results is 0.

operations.description: Deletes a generator service.
List all available generators

parameters.name: guid
parameters.description: Filter to generator with this guid

parameters.name: service_guid
parameters.description: Filter to generator from this service

parameters.name: service_uri
parameters.description: Filter to generator from this service URI

parameters.name: attribute_name
parameters.description: Filter to generators that use this attribute

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Filter to generator with this key

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of records to return

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Used to paginate. First page of results is 0.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: The search query. At the moment, we do case insensitive exact match search.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of records to return

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Used to paginate. First page of results is 0.

operations.description: Search all memberships. Results are always paginated.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of records to return

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Used to paginate. First page of results is 0.

operations.description: Search all membership requests. Results are always paginated.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of records to return

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Used to paginate. First page of results is 0.

operations.description: Create a membership request
Accepts this membership request. User will become a member of the specified organization.
Declines this membership request. User will NOT become a member of the specified organization.
Search all organizations. Results are always paginated.

parameters.name: guid
parameters.description: Finds the organization with this guid, if any

parameters.name: user_guid
parameters.description: If specified, restricts to organizations that this user is specifically a member of (e.g. will exclude public organizations with which the user does not have a direct membership).

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Find organizations with this key. Case in-sensitive. Exact match

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Find organizations with this name. Case in-sensitive. Exact match

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: Find organizations with this namespace. Case in-sensitive. Exact match

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of records to return

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Used to paginate. First page of results is 0.

operations.description: Returns the organization with this key.
Create a new organization.
Update an organization.
Deletes an organization and all of its associated applications.
Returns all attribute values for this organization. Results are always paginated.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Find the values for the attribute with this name.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of records to return

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Used to paginate. First page of results is 0.

operations.description: Returns the attribute value with this name.
Create or update a new attribute value.
Deletes the attribute value with the specified name. Only the user who created an attribute value can delete it.

Change the password for this token. If the token is invalid, has been used, or otherwise no longer can be applied, errors will be returned as 409s. A 204 represents that the user has successfully changed their password.
Create a new password reset. This will send the user an email with a link to reset their password.
Search subscriptions. Always paginated.

parameters.name: guid
parameters.description: Find the subscription with this guid.

parameters.name: organization_key
parameters.description: Find subscriptions for this organization.

parameters.name: user_guid
parameters.description: Find subscriptions for this user.

parameters.name: publication
parameters.description: Find subscriptions for this publication.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of records to return

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Used to paginate. First page of results is 0.

operations.description: Returns information about a specific subscription.
Create a new subscription.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of records to return

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Used to paginate. First page of results is 0.

operations.description: Used to fetch the clear text token.
Create a new API token for this user
Search for a specific user. You must specify at least 1 parameter - either a guid, email or token - and will receive back either 0 or 1 users.

parameters.name: guid
parameters.description: Find user with this guid. Exact match

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Find user with this email address. Case in-sensitive. Exact match

parameters.name: nickname
parameters.description: Find user with the specified nickname. For users that register via GitHub, this will be their GitHub username. Case in-sensitive. Exact match

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: Find the user with this API token. Exact match

operations.description: Returns information about the user with this guid.

Used to authenticate a user with an email address and password. Successful authentication returns an instance of the user model. Failed authorizations of any kind are returned as a generic error with code user_authorization_failed.
Used to authenticate a user using a github access token. This is equivalent to running the following command to get the user info: curl -H 'Authorization: Bearer code' https://api.github.com/user

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: The GitHub assigned oauth token

operations.description: Create a new user.
Updates information about the user with the specified guid.

resources.description: Public resource that can accept JSON input and returns a validation object describing any validation errors.

operations.description: Search all versions of this application. Results are always paginated.

parameters.name: orgKey
parameters.description: The organization key for which to search versions

parameters.name: applicationKey
parameters.description: The application key for which to search versions

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of records to return

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Used to paginate. First page of results is 0.

operations.description: Retrieve a specific version of an application.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: The version of tthis application to download, or the keyword latest to get the latest version

operations.description: Create a new version for an application
Upsert a version of an application
Deletes a specific version.
Generates an example JSON document of the type with the specified name.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: The version of this application to download, or the keyword latest to get the latest version

parameters.name: type_name
parameters.description: The name of the type (e.g. model name) for which you would like to generate a sample json document

parameters.name: sub_type_name
parameters.description: The name of the sub-type for which you would like to generate a sample json document, e.g. a specific type of a union

parameters.name: optional_fields
parameters.description: If true, we generate sample data for all optional fields. Otherwise the generated sample will contain only required fields, where applicable

operations.description: Search attributes. Always paginated.

parameters.name: guid
parameters.description: Find the watch with this guid.

parameters.name: user_guid
parameters.description: Find attributes for this user.

parameters.name: organization_key
parameters.description: Find attributes for this organization.

parameters.name: application_key
parameters.description: Find attributes for this application.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of records to return

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Used to paginate. First page of results is 0.

operations.description: Returns information about a specific watch.
Quick check if a user is watching a specific application.

parameters.name: user_guid
parameters.description: The user for which we are checking. API returns false if the user guid is not provided

operations.description: Create a new watch.
